decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 2212-P/EX/01;  2212-P/EX/02;  2212-P/P/01;  2212-P/EX/02;  2212-P/L&S/01;  2212-P/W&ED-G/01;  2212-P/W-F/01;  2212-P/DL-W/01; Design and Access Statement

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings. The replacement windows shall maintain the appearance (with exception of double-glazing), opening style, colour, frame thickness, rebate and finer detailing of the existing windows.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.47, 7B, 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and the Brentham Garden Estate Management Plan (2008).
description: Instillation of timber double-glazed windows and door to replace the existing timber single-glazed fenestrations; including the insertion of a new bigger window to the ground floor rear elevation.
